title: Gauley River National Recreation Area: Things To Do
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do             Things To Do                 Located in southern West Virginia between the towns of Summersville and Fayetteville, Gauley River National Recreation Area includes 25 miles of the Gauley River, and five miles of the Meadow River. These swift, winding rivers and their narrow canyons are protected by the National Park Service. Whitewater paddling and fishing are several of the more popular activities on the Gauley and Meadow Rivers. For more information on the Gauley River see American Whitewater's website at: http://www.americanwhitewater.org         Whitewater Information  Check here for information on whitewater rafting, river levels, and release schedules. more...              Camping Check here for information about camping in and near the park. more...          Fishing Check here for information about fishing at Gauley River National Recreation Area. more...          Nearby Attractions   Check here for other places to visit near Gauley River National Recreation Area. more...
